Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2013 08:39AM muthom-stage4 wrote: I am thankful that I just received my approval letter for SS Disability.  It will not start paying until December, but fortunately my husband's work offered an Aflak plan which we signed up for last year.  They pay out a lump sump for a critical diagnois.  So that money should tied us over until the diability kicks in.  I don't know how people do this without insurance.

Posts.Title: Yes, PINK needs changes - However.... muthom-stage4 Iwillwinthisbattle

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2013 12:18AM muthom-stage4 wrote: Sorry to hear about the possible mets.  My breast cancer spread to my sternum also.  I have a sternum biopsy on 5/31 (my wedding anniversary).  They gave me an iv which was suppose to sedate me, but I was awake for the whole procedure.  It was done with a CT scan for the doctor to make sure he hit the bone.  It didn't hurt that much while he was doing it (they used a local).  I think I once winced once or twice.  The bone bruise did hurt, but Advil was enough to take care of the pain.  It was bruised for about a week.  I think it was less painful than the breast biopsy.  However the breast biopsy healed quicker.  Hope that information helps.  Wish you the best.
Posts.Title: Mets to sternum Pat634 Pat634
